Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town Mystery and Airport Announcement
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the mysterious setting of Ghost Town, the initial temporal anomaly experienced by the woman in the green hat, and the subsequent revelation of plans to destroy Ghost Town for an airport.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Anomaly in Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the setting of Ghost Town and the woman in the green hat's initial reaction to the seemingly authentic historical atmosphere.

narrative_arcs.title: Woman's Internal Thoughts on Time Discrepancy

sub_scenes.title: Urgency to Leave Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a conversation between a man and a blonde woman, revealing a sense of danger and urgency associated with Ghost Town and the desire to leave.

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Memories and Modern Reality
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to Nan's personal memories of Ghost Town, contrasting her romanticized past with the jarring intrusion of modern reality.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification of Ghost Town's Current State

sub_scenes.title: Reaction to Demolition Plans
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan's shocked and emotional reaction to the news that Ghost Town is to be demolished for an airport, and the surveyor's justification.

narrative_arcs.title: Reaction to Airport Plan - Initial Shock and Disbelief

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Dynamics and Ghost Town's Demise
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the relationship between Nan and Cal, contrasting Nan's romantic ideals with Cal's practicality, culminating in the demolition of Ghost Town and its emotional impact.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Notions vs. Practical Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into the dynamics of Nan and Cal's relationship, highlighting Nan's 'romantic notions' and Cal's more grounded perspective on love.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Perspective on Dreams and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: The Demolition and Immediate Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks the shift to the actual demolition of Ghost Town, showing the chaotic scene and Nan's distressed reaction.

Major_Arcs.title: Business, Paternal Conflict, and Mother's Counsel
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on business logistics related to the airport construction, Nan's conflict with her father regarding her opinions and involvement, and her mother's and maid's attempts to console her and offer relationship advice.

sub_scenes.title: Business Discussions and Nan's Frustration
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces business conversations related to the airport construction and Nan's frustration with being excluded and dismissed.

sub_scenes.title: Humiliation and Consolation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan's emotional reaction to her father's treatment and the attempts to console her by the maid and her mother.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation of Cal's Affection and Effort

Major_Arcs.title: Nan's Resolve and Business Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's internal resolve to understand her relationship with Cal, her decision to confront him, and her subsequent business confrontation regarding the horse deal for the airport construction.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Determination for Clarity
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan's internal resolve to seek clarity in her relationship with Cal, despite reassurances from others.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Business and Deal Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a time-sensitive business matter regarding horses for the airport and Nan's assertive confrontation related to a business deal.

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation and Departure with Cal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's emotional confrontation, Nan's confession of feelings, Cal's cryptic responses, and his departure, followed by Nan's frustrated reaction and a time jump.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession to Cal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan confessing her deep feelings to Cal and seeking clarity about their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Cryptic Response

sub_scenes.title: Time Passage and Lingering Longing
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene uses narrative exposition to describe the passage of time and Nan's emotional state during Cal's absence.

narrative_arcs.title: Passage of Time and Lingering Longing
Confession of Pursuit and Revealed Motivation

Major_Arcs.title: Snowstorm, Livestock Crisis, and Operation Hay Lift
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to a severe snowstorm, its impact on livestock, the community's worry, and the hopeful arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift' as a resolution to the fodder crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Weather Report
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene continues the intimate conversation between Nan and Cal but is interrupted by a grim weather report.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Confession about Changed Behavior

sub_scenes.title: Livestock Fodder Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene highlights the immediate crisis caused by the snowstorm - the lack of fodder for livestock.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Discussion of Weather and Worry for Loved Ones
Cal's Determined Resolve and Acceptance of Responsibility

sub_scenes.title: Despair and Hope with Hay Lift
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the shift from despair and hopelessness to relief and renewed hope with the arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift'.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollection of Restlessness and Expression of Hopelessness
Arrival of the Plane and Fodder Drop
Relief, Gratitude, and Renewed Hope with 'Operation Hay Lift'

Major_Arcs.title: Western Town Showdown and Differing Perspectives
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a Western town scene with a cowboy showdown and presents varied perspectives on the cowboy's actions and character, setting up themes of heroism and maturity.

sub_scenes.title: Cowboy Confrontation and Town Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a dramatic cowboy showdown in a Western town and captures the diverse reactions of the townspeople.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense and Critique of Cowboy's Manners

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Hero Worship and Sally's Concern
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Sally's concern about her brother Jeff's hero worship of Clyde Surrett, their sibling conflict over guns, and Sally's attempts to guide Jeff away from what she perceives as a dangerous path.

sub_scenes.title: Worry about Jeff's Hero Fixation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Sally's concern about Jeff's admiration for heroes and his current fascination with force.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Concern for Jeff's Hero Worship
Sally's Disappointment and Jeff's Clyde Surrett Defense
Jeff's Justification of Clyde Surrett and Dismissal of Chane Benson
Sally's Rejection of Jeff's Claims and Warning
Jeff's Threat and Sally's Fearful Response

Major_Arcs.title: Seeking Help for Jeff and Benson-Surrett Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Sally's escalating concern for Jeff, her plea to Clyde Surrett for help, Pete's commitment to intervene, and the introduction of Mr. Benson and the rising tension between Clyde Surrett and Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Deepening Worry for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene highlights Sally's increasing frustration and worry about Jeff's unmanageable behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and His Reassurance
Pete's Commitment to Helping Jeff and Sally's Appreciation
Pete's Flashback and Gun Advice to Young Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and His Humble Response

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Conflict and Benson's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the escalating conflict due to Clyde's article, Sally's warning to Mr. Benson, and Mr. Benson's decision to stay and fight.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Warning to Mr. Benson about Clyde's Anger
Mr. Benson's Dismissal of Danger and Confrontation with Sally
Mr. Benson's Justification for Staying in Town

sub_scenes.title: Clyde's Defiance and Benson Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the direct confrontations Clyde faces due to his article, his unwavering stance, and the discussion between Sally and Jeff about the escalating situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Defense Regarding Clyde's Article
Background on Clyde's Defiant Actions and Consequences
Sally and Jeff's Discussion about Clyde and Benson's Conflict
Dinner Invitation and Evaluation of Chane's Skills

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner Deception, Confrontation, and Benson's Violence
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the dinner with Chane, the subsequent confrontation between Jeff and Sally, Jeff's physical aggression, and Benson's violent intervention to protect Chane.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner and Moonlight Deception
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the scene at dinner and reveals Chane's awareness of ulterior motives behind the invitation, followed by a seemingly polite moonlight scene.

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Violent Intervention
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Chane's arrival at the scene of Jeff and Sally's confrontation, followed by Benson's sudden and violent assault on Jeff.

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit of Clyde and Town Showdown
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Sally and Jeff's urgent pursuit to town to find Chane and Clyde, culminating in a town confrontation involving Benson, and a subsequent tense wait for resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Ride to Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Sally's urgency to reach town and Jeff's determined ride to follow Chane and protect Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Urgency and Chane's Pursuit of Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Tense Wait and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the escalating tension during the town confrontation, the subsequent tense wait, and the final resolution with Benson leaving town.

narrative_arcs.title: Anticipation and Fear at the Door

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Management and Steve Daley's Arrival
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting at a ranch, a physical brawl, and the arrival of Steve Daley as the new boss, setting up a mystery regarding ranch troubles and Betsy's role.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Brawl and New Hired Man
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with a ranch brawl and introduces Steve Daley as the new hired man, creating initial curiosity about his role.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Brawl and Rejection of Gunplay
Introducing Steve Daley and the New Boss
Confirmation of Betsy's Competence and Steve's Approval

sub_scenes.title: Testing Steve and Ranch Troubles Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy testing Steve's character and introduces the serious troubles plaguing the Double Bar ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Casual Acceptance and Betsy's Amusement
Hank's Skepticism and Betsy's Defense of Steve
Betsy's Accusation and Hank's Explanation of Ranch Troubles
Mutual Caution and Agreement to Investigate
Departure to Town and Buckboard Ride
Questioning Hank's Orders and Material for Dress

Major_Arcs.title: Town Confrontation and Romantic Revelation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Betsy and Steve's arrival in town, their confrontation with Fred Bridges' men, Steve's fighting skills, and the subsequent romantic revelations between Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Town Arrival and Bridges' Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy and Steve arriving in town and immediately facing a confrontational greeting from Fred Bridges and his men.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Policy and Romantic Proposition
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Betsy asserting her ranch policy against gunmen, followed by Steve's revelation of his feelings and a romantic proposition.

Major_Arcs.title: Gun Policy, Love Proof, and Romantic Commitment
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Betsy's strong stance against guns, her condition for Steve to prove his love by giving up his gun, and their ultimate romantic commitment symbolized by a kiss.

sub_scenes.title: Gun Policy Conflict and Love Condition
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the conflict arising from Betsy's gun policy and her demand for Steve to give up his gun as proof of love.

Major_Arcs.title: Bridges' Revenge and Pursuit
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Old Man Bridges' complaint leading to his men threatening trespassers, Betsy warning Steve about danger on the valley route, and the ensuing pursuit and flashback of Steve's betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Complaint and Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Old Man Bridges complaining to Betsy and his men threatening trespassers, setting up a new conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Valley Route Warning and Impending Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the dramatic confrontation at Devil's Pass, Betsy's intervention and injury, and the subsequent romantic reunion and resolution between Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Showdown and Injury
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Steve's arrival at Devil's Pass, the confrontation with his father's killer, and Betsy's intervention leading to her injury.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Romance, Fencing Dispute, and Gun Violence Threat
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new romantic storyline with the Rancher's Daughter and Dave, introduces a ranch fencing dispute, and escalates into a threat of gun violence, setting up a new conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Romance and Concern for Dave
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new romantic dynamic with the Rancher's Daughter and Dave, and her concern for Dave's emotional state and her father's potential disapproval.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dave and Father's Disapproval
Reflection on Morning Routine and Curley's Presence
Concern about Curley and Bear Fenin's Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Fencing Dispute and Escalating Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a rancher's angry complaint about a new fence, leading to a confrontation with Fred Gordon and escalating into a threat of gun violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Dispute Over Fencing and Grazing Land
Escalating Tension Over Fence and Water Access
Defensive Stance and Threat of Gunplay
Curley's Gun Draw and Impending Violence

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Entanglements and Business Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Curley's apology, Carrie's conflicted feelings between Dave and Fred, her reconciliation with Fred, and then her realization of Fred's business betrayal and subsequent rejection.

sub_scenes.title: Curley's Apology and Romantic Confusion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Curley's apology to Carrie and transitions into Carrie and Dave's conversation about their feelings and Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave Discussing Feelings and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Business Betrayal and Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Fred's business-driven motives and Carrie's angry confrontation and rejection upon realizing his betrayal.

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation Resolution and Final Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's confrontation at Carlton's office, her emotional breakdown and comfort, the resolution of the conflict with Fred, and her final romantic union with Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Office Confrontation and Emotional Release
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie's confrontation with Fred and Carlton at Carlton's office, followed by her emotional breakdown and seeking comfort.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office

sub_scenes.title: Victorious Reflection and Reunion with Dave
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie reflecting on her victory over Fred and her chance encounter and conversation with Dave at the store.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Fred's Defeat and Carrie's Victory
Chance Encounter and Casual Conversation at the Store
Inquiries About Fred and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Illness, Reconciliation, and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie's illness, the arrival of Fred and Carlton, the confrontation by Carrie's father, and the final romantic reconciliation and marriage proposal between Carrie and Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Concern and Arrival of Visitors

Major_Arcs.title: Chris and Dirk's Escape and Chris's Romance with Rance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows a separate storyline focused on Chris and Dirk, their escape plan, the chase by the Marshal (Rance Cready), the shootout, Rance's injury, and the unexpected romantic union between Chris and Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Request and Brother's Injury Reveal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chris and Dirk, with Dirk's urgent request for help and the revelation of his gunshot wound.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation Plan and Encounter with Marshal Cready
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Chris's father planning to investigate, his departure, and Chris's encounter with Marshal Rance Cready.

narrative_arcs.title: Escalating Confrontation and Claim of Authority

sub_scenes.title: Accusation, Conditional Stay, and Time Passage
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Rance Cready's accusation and legal justification for arresting Dirk, his conditional offer to stay, and a time jump showing weeks passing.

narrative_arcs.title: Passage of Time and Acceptance of Reality

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Chris's love confession to Rance, their mutual affection, and Chris's decision to help Dirk escape despite her feelings for Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Re-emergence of Duty and Dirk's Fate

sub_scenes.title: The Chase, Shootout, and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the chase by the Marshal, the ensuing shootout, Rance's injury, and the moral dilemma of whether to kill the injured Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Moral Dilemma: Mercy Killing vs. Survival

sub_scenes.title: First Aid, Escape, and Final Romantic Union
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Chris providing first aid, Rance's internal reflections and realization of Chris's love, Dirk's departure and confession, and the final romantic union of Chris and Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Providing First Aid and Assessing Injury
Parting Ways and Concern for Criminal Escape
Plea to Return and Confession of Love
Rance's Self-Recrimination and Awareness of Burden
Concern for Riding and Inquiry about Dirk
Successful Escape to Mexico and Relief
Rance's Reassurance and Readiness for Action
